name: NUS
description: The National University of Singapore (NUS) is Singapore’s flagship university, which offers a global approach to education, research and enterprise, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. We have 16 colleges, faculties and schools across three campuses in Singapore, with more than 40,000 students from 100 countries enriching our vibrant and diverse campus community. We have also established more than 20 NUS Overseas Colleges entrepreneurial hubs around the world.
business_objectives: Accelerate Skill Development and Learning Efficiency
Headline: Dreamers. Trailblazers. Changemakers of Tomorrow.
ShortDescription: At NUS, we believe in education, research and service that change lives.

Highlights.name: Top Ranked
Highlights.description: NUS is a world-class university, ranking #8 globally (QS World University Rankings).

Highlights.name: Global Hub
Highlights.description: With over 38,000 students from 100+ countries, NUS offers a vibrant and diverse campus life.

Highlights.name: Research Powerhouse
Highlights.description: NUS prioritizes research and innovation, attracting top minds and creating real-world solutions.

key_use_cases: Improving learning efficiency within an organization
Managing corporate learning programs via an LMS
Authoring and creating learning content for training initiatives
competitive_advantages: Leverages the expertise and academic rigor of a top-ranked global university (#8 globally by QS World University Rankings)
Offers a global perspective and diverse learning environment, potentially influencing its learning solutions
Rooted in a strong research and innovation culture, which may inform its learning methodologies and content
primary_users: Content creators (e.g., instructional designers, subject matter experts)
scalability_features: Designed to support a large number of users (e.g., implied by over 40,000 students and 2.5K faculty within the university context, and targeting Large/Global Enterprises)
Supports global operations and diverse user bases (implied by 'Global Hub' and '100+ countries')
